jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.description:
About the Role
We are looking for a software engineer who specializes in the Java/JVM platform to join our Identity and Access Management (IAM) team. You will be responsible for analyzing integration requirements for our clients, implementation, operation, and documentation for the platform. You will work closely with both internal and external stakeholders across Morningstar Technology, Data, Products, Sales/Service, and Research. We want to work with other engineers who bring knowledge and excitement about working with us. This position is based in our Mumbai office.
Job Responsibilities
Take ownership of the IAM product with a "gets things done" attitude.
Analyze and remediate production issues and build instrumentation and operational readiness into the systems architecture.
Build and maintain well designed, well-engineered, stable, scalable products across a variety of markets.
Maintain architectural direction, security and quality standards in your designs.
Enforce good Agile practices (using JIRA) including test-driven development and continuous integration.
Apply DevOps practices in area of continuous and automated deployment.
Help to shape product vision.
Qualifications
Completed Bachelor s degree in Computer Science or related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience developing software solutions, preferably in a Unix environment.
Excellent listening, written and verbal communication skills.
Organized and able to remain productive even when you have multiple deliverables.
Ability to understand and leverage new technologies, potentially wearing many hats including business analyst, DBA, QA, and project manager.
Passionate about quality, process, programming, and investing in general, seeing opportunities for improvement, seizing them, and then sharing your findings with others.
Understanding of how to protect web applications from common security vulnerabilities.
Experience supporting software products serving over 100M monthly requests.
Experience with cloud computing (preferably AWS)
Experience with DevOps tools (e.g. CodeDeploy, CodePipeline, Splunk, Git, Jenkins).
Experience with modern development practices in areas of product design, requirement analysis, test driven development, and test automation
Experience in Java, Spring Boot, JUnit, Maven, XML, JSON, Tomcat, IDEA/Eclipse is preferred.
Experience with Agile methodology and tools like Jira.
Nice to Haves
Experience full-stack web development is preferred.
Experience with functional programming concepts & reactive design would be a plus.
Shift Timings:
One position for morning shift and other position in second shift.
Morningstar is an equal opportunity employer

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.description:
Position Purpose


Position for Devops and Cloud engineer expert for managing the Devops requirements of Credit Application modules/components. He/she would need to contribute to proposing devops improvements and present to technical architecture and lead community, and implement solution in Credit Application. He/she would need to mentor the team in Devops, take knowledge sharing session, do peer programming and help team to improve teams skill on this.

Responsibilities

Direct Responsibilities


# Add/Manage Jenkins CI CD pipeline.

# Migration of environment to Kubernetes.

# Managing of various non-prod environments used in the application.

# Analyzing environment/deployment specific issues reported and providing solutions.

# Conduct knowledge sharing sessions to team and contribute to creating Devops leadership.

# Coaching Mentoring, Peer programming.

# Propose improvements in Devops area and present the same in technical committees.

# Follow all the best practices and quality process of the project.

# Contribute to Devops obsolescence management.

# Follow existing process defined in the program

Contributing Responsibilities


# Contribute to hiring by conducting technical interviews in ISPL

# Acquire and share knowledge on technical topics within and across teams

Technical Behavioral Competencies


Must have Thorough knowledge and hands on experience on below:

Git and bitbucket for Source code management (Version Control System).

Jenkins: for automating server deployments with plugins for constructing CI/CD pipelines.

Docker: for software containerization.

Kubernetes: for container orchestration.

Sonar: for code quality

Ansible, Groovy: for configuration management and deployment.

Unix scripting

Security: Vault (CyberArk)

Optional:

Dynatrace

Any Cloud platform IBM Cloud, AWS, Azure

Specific Qualifications (if required)


Skills Referential

Ability to deliver / Results driven

Ability to collaborate / Teamwork

Attention to detail / rigor

Creativity Innovation / Problem solving

Transversal Skills: (Please select up to 5 skills)

Ability to develop others improve their skills

Ability to anticipate business / strategic evolution

Analytical Ability

Ability to manage / facilitate a meeting, seminar, committee, training

Choose an item.

Education Level:

Bachelor Degree or equivalent

Experience Level

At least 7 years

jobs.title: Devops Engineer
jobs.description:
DevOps Engineer CI / CD Team

Key Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipelines to automate the software development process.
Good at groovy scripting. Able to design, create, troubleshoot the Jenkins pipeline code.
Strong Hands on DevOps CICD tools like: Jenkins, SonarQube, CxOne, Jfrog.
Excellent understanding and knowledge about the DevOps CiCd process.
Collaborate with development teams to ensure seamless integration of new features.
Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues in production / non-production environments.
Develop scripts for automation of operational tasks and system monitoring.
Ensure security best practices are followed throughout the development lifecycle.
Provide Level 2 /3 technical support for production systems.
Document processes, procedures, and best practices for team reference.
Basic Cloud exp will do for GCP, AWS, Azure and various services experience.

Required skills:

Proven 3-4 years’ up to 8 years’ experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role.
Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Bash, or Ruby.
Basic Linux knowledge is mandatory.
Strong knowledge of CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI).
Experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Familiarity with configuration management tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible).
Excellent problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.

Secondary skills

Networking/certificate management knowledge will be add-on
At least any 1 database knowledge, Postgres would be advantages.
ITIL process awareness i.e. (Change/Incident/Problem Mgmt)
Knowledge about Releases management
Creating Best practices & SOPs

Thanks & Regards,

Aditi Agarwal

jobs.title: Devops Engineer
jobs.description:
Devops JD

DevOps for applications focuses on streamlining and automating the development, deployment, and maintenance processes.
Here’s a high-level overview: Key DevOps Practices for Application Development
1. Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
• Automates the process of integrating code changes and deploying them to production.
• Tools: Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, CircleCI.


2. Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
• Manages infrastructure using code to ensure consistency and repeatability.
• Tools: Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, Ansible.


3. Containerization and Orchestration
• Packages applications in containers for consistency across environments.
• Orchestration tools manage container deployment.
• Tools: Docker, Kubernetes.


4. Monitoring and Logging
• Provides visibility into application performance and system health.
• Tools: Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.description:
Description:


We are looking for an experienced Technical Consultant with expertise in Cloud Infrastructure, DevOps, and System Administration. The ideal candidate will have strong hands-on experience in cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP), infrastructure provisioning, CI/CD pipelines, application hosting environments, and automation. Experience in setting up and managing Adobe Commerce (Magento), Adobe Campaign, and Adobe Experience Manager platforms will be a strong advantage.


Requirements:

Hands-on experience in DevOps and System Administration (On-Premise Data Center / Public Cloud – AWS, Azure, GCP).
Strong knowledge of Unix/Linux/Windows installation and administration.
Good understanding of application infrastructure components and cloud services.
Experience setting up cloud instances and services (Load Balancers, DNS, Storage, Databases, Monitoring, etc.).
Proven expertise in setting up Adobe Commerce (Magento), Adobe Campaign, and Adobe Experience Manager infrastructures.
Strong troubleshooting skills in application infrastructure management.
Experience with scripting/automation (Shell, Python, Perl).
Experience with DevOps frameworks, CI/CD automation using Jenkins, and build/release management using Ant/Maven.
Knowledge of auto-scaling strategies for cloud infrastructure.
Good to have: Automation/provisioning tools – Ansible, Puppet, Chef.

Job Responsibilities:

Understand public cloud (AWS/GCP/Azure) specifications and client requirements to design & develop provisioning methodologies.
Provision and deploy cloud infrastructure and application hosting environments.
Manage DevOps pipelines, CI/CD automation (Jenkins), and pipeline expansion.
Translate non-functional requirements into platform designs meeting performance & security standards.
Understand middleware requirements and deploy application environments in the cloud.
Collaborate with client infrastructure architects to align with security standards.
Work with client teams on infrastructure needs (Storage, Firewalls, DNS, SSL, etc.) for end-to-end solutions.
Set up on-premise infrastructure for Adobe Commerce (Magento) in distributed architecture (Nginx, Redis, Varnish, Elasticsearch, MySQL).
Build infrastructure platforms for Adobe Campaign and Adobe Experience Manager.

What We Offer:


Exciting Projects: We focus on industries like High-Tech, communication, media, healthcare, retail and telecom. Our customer list is full of fantastic global brands and leaders who love what we build for them.

Collaborative Environment: You Can expand your skills by collaborating with a diverse team of highly talented people in an open, laidback environment — or even abroad in one of our global centers or client facilities!

Work-Life Balance: GlobalLogic prioritizes work-life balance, which is why we offer flexible work schedules, opportunities to work from home, and paid time off and holidays.

Professional Development: Our dedicated Learning & Development team regularly organizes Communication skills training(GL Vantage, Toast Master),Stress Management program, professional certifications, and technical and soft skill trainings.

Excellent Benefits: We provide our employees with competitive salaries, family medical insurance, Group Term Life Insurance, Group Personal Accident Insurance , NPS(National Pension Scheme ), Periodic health awareness program, extended maternity leave, annual performance bonuses, and referral bonuses.

Fun Perks: We want you to love where you work, which is why we host sports events, cultural activities, offer food on subsidies rates, Corporate parties. Our vibrant offices also include dedicated GL Zones, rooftop decks and GL Club where you can drink coffee or tea with your colleagues over a game of table and offer discounts for popular stores and restaurants!

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.description:
Title: Lead Devops Engineer

Location: Mumbai




Role Overview:

We are seeking a Lead DevOps Engineer to spearhead the design, implementation, and management of scalable and secure infrastructure across Azure and GCP. The ideal candidate will bring strong expertise in Cosmos DB, MySQL, and server scripting, while leading a team to deliver automation, reliability, and performance across environments. This role involves both hands-on technical contributions and strategic leadership of DevOps practices.




Key Responsibilities:

Lead the DevOps strategy and roadmap across Azure and GCP platforms.
Architect and manage CI/CD pipelines, ensuring smooth application delivery and rollback
Oversee administration and optimization of Cosmos DB and MySQL databases for scalability, performance, and security.
Develop and enforce best practices for infrastructure as code (IaC) using Terraform, ARM templates, or Deployment Manager.
Design and implement automation scripts (Bash, Shell, Python, PowerShell) for system tasks, deployments, and monitoring.
Guide the adoption of containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes).
Lead efforts in system monitoring, incident management, and performance tuning with observability tools (Grafana, Prometheus, ELK, Splunk).
Ensure infrastructure security, compliance, and patch management across multi-cloud environments.
Mentor and guide a team of DevOps engineers, fostering technical excellence and knowledge sharing.
Collaborate with development, prod




Required Skills & Experience:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience.
8+ years of experience in DevOps, with at least 2–3 years in a leadership role.
Strong expertise in Azure and GCP services (compute, networking, storage, IAM).
Proven hands-on experience with Cosmos DB and MySQL database administration.
Proficiency in server scripting (Bash, Shell, Python, PowerShell).
Strong knowledge of CI/CD tools (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitLab CI, etc.).
Solid understanding of containers and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience in infrastructure automation (Terraform, Ansible, ARM templates).
Strong troubleshooting skills with ability to resolve complex system, network, and application issues.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.description:
Experience with containers preferably Docker. Packaging applications as containers and running them in clusters.
Setting up network interfaces and ports in containers. Knowledge of solutions like AWS ECS.
Must have knowledge of networking constructs like VPC, Subnets, Security Groups, NAT gateway etc.
Knowledge of both RDBMS and NoSQL cluster management and performance tuning parameters.
Must have hands on with CI | CD practices. Familiarity with technologies like puppet, ansible, chef, Jenkins etc.
Understanding of doing zero downtime deployments. Experience with deployment concepts like blue-green, canary etc.
Must have worked with micro services based deployments handling communication between various services.

Candidate Profile:

Must have 3+ years of exposure to cloud platform preferably AWS.
Comfort and ambition to grow in fast paced ecosystem.

jobs.title: DevOps & Platform Engineer
jobs.location: Mumbai, Noida, Pune, Chennai, Gurugram, Bengaluru
jobs.description:
Exp- 5-12 years experience
Locations- Bangalore, Hyderabad, Chennai, Coimbatore, Noida, Gurgaon, Pune, Mumbai
Mandatory Skills- Kubernetes, Terraform, AWS Networking, Python experience
How You Will Make an Impact/ Job Requirements:
Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipelines using AWS/Azure/GCP DevOps tools and services.
Configure and maintain build agents, release pipelines, and automation scripts for deployment processes.
Utilize Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles to automate the provisioning and management of Azure resources using tools like ARM templates or Terraform
Manage and optimize source code repositories using version control systems (e.g., Git) within Azure DevOps.
Implement branching strategies and code merging processes to ensure efficient collaboration among development teams.
Continuous Integration:
Set up and manage automated build processes to ensure the reliability and consistency of code compilation.
Integrate automated testing into the CI pipeline for code quality assurance.
Implement security best practices for Azure resources and ensure compliance with industry standards.
Collaborate with security teams to conduct regular security assessments and address vulnerabilities.
Implement monitoring solutions to track application performance and system health.
Configure logging and tracing mechanisms for troubleshooting and analysis.
Good communication and problem-solving skills.
